intro: Monotropastrum globosum var. tripetalum, commonly known as the three-petaled mistletoe, is a parasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy, evergreen leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often clustered together. Its fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. This species is native to parts of Australia and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
